newsitem.title: USA: USAir to negotiate for wide-body aircraft.
newsitem.headline: USAir to negotiate for wide-body aircraft.

text.p: USAir Group Inc, which recently ordered up to 400 single-aisle Airbus Industrie aircraft, said it expects to enter talks for wide-body aircraft, such as Boeing 777s and Airbus A330s.
"Our 767-200s are too small. We need bigger aircraft," for long-haul and international services, said USAir Chairman Stephen Wolf.
But USAir said a potential wide-body aircraft order would be dependent on first achieving a "competitive cost structure."
USAir also said, during a presentation before industry analysts, that financing for its recent order for 400 Airbus aircraft is dependent on cutting costs.

The Arlington, Va-based carrier and its labor groups are currently in talks to reduce operating costs, which remain among the highest in the industry. Labor costs costs comprise about 40 percent of USAir's operating costs.
"We are not going to get financing for the aircraft with our current cost structure," Wolf said, referring to the 400-plane order.
USAir, which is streamlining its fleet, said it does not plan to take delivery of eight previously ordered Boeing 757 aircraft.
